Whenever we note that we keep needing a certain sequence of commands, itâ€™s good to put them into a function. The function body contains the instructions that we want to do over and over again, the function arguments take those things that we may want to vary. Write a function to compute the probability of having a maximum as big as `m` when looking across `n` Poisson variables with rate `lambda`.


```{r}

## -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
poismax = function(lambda, n, m) {
  epsilon = 1 - ppois(m - 1, lambda)
  1 - exp( -n * epsilon)
}
poismax(lambda = 0.5, n = 100, m = 7)
poismax(lambda = mean(e100), n = 100, m = 7)
```


```{r}

## -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
poismax = function(lambda, n = 100, m = 7) {
  1 - exp( -n * (1 - ppois(m - 1, lambda)))
}
poismax(0.5)
poismax(0.5, m = 9)
```

```{r}

  sum((o-e)^2 / e)
}
```

```{r}

## -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
B = 10000
n = length(Celegans$chrM)

oenull = replicate(B,
  oestat(e = expected, o = rmultinom(1, n, p = rep(1/4, 4))))
```
